DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Not Attempt Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the reason no attempt was made to perform breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Not Attempt
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to no attempt to perform breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:used for negation of a word or group of words.:An activity intended to do or accomplish something.  Routinely used as in "number of tries to complete a procedure".

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
used for negation of a word or group of words.
An activity intended to do or accomplish something.  Routinely used as in "number of tries to complete a procedure".

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
